Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2008 04:04PM - edited Feb 21, 2008 04:07PM by JULIECG I was diagnosed with Stage I breast cancer in June 2002 and mets/Stage IV in June 2007.  Since June 2007 I have been on Abraxane/Avastin combination.  Avastin is not yet approved for breast cancer, only colorectal and lung cancers.  Recently, the FDA advisory panel voted 5 - 4 to not recommend the approval of Avastin for breast cancer.  The FDA will supposedly announce their final decision later this month.  Usually, the FDA follows the panel's recommendations.   The panel's decision was based in part upon their conclusion that Avastin doesn't extend survival rates.  There is a lot of dispute about this.  My oncologist disagrees with the studies relied upon by the panel - their methods and conclusions.  All I know is that Avastin is working for me as I am NED (no evidence of disease) as of December 2007.  The only side effects I have had are a little blood in my nose (not full on nose bleeds)  and bloody gums.  Sorry to hear about your mom.  Do your research, get all of the facts and good luck with the treatment.  Julie CG.
Posts.Title: Avastin for breast cancer? sarika_for_mama sarika_for_mama
Anyone not fatigued by Rads? Breeze shepherdess

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2007 05:41AM JULIECG wrote: Cy - I had whole brain radiation for brain mets in June of this year.  I believe I had 14 treatments.  While receiving radiation I was taking Temodar - an oral chemotherapy for brain cancer.  I was initially dx with numerous small lesions. My latest MRI shows no evidence of disease.  As of today I have not experienced any side effects from the radiation - other than hair loss.  When I first went in, my radiation oncologist told me not to read anything on the internet about brain mets or whole brain radiation because there is a lot of scary stuff out there that didn't apply to me.  Since I have routine MRIs I've been told that if any one thing pops up at this point I could proceed with gamma knife which is very effective.   Good Luck.  JulieCG Dx 6/2002 DCIS, er+/her2-,mastectomy; 6/2007 dx mets to bones, lymph nodes and brain; 9/07 NED
